title: How to become a financial advisor - Quora

response.answer_text: A Financial Advisor’s main role is to offer financial guidance to clients to choose which products are most suitable for their financial situation. This could be insurance, mortgage, loans, investments, savings, retirement, or any other service which may improve a client’s current or future financial status. As per TheStreet, “According to the U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS), only 24% of financial advisors in 2016 were self-employed. If you want to work in the field, you'll need to work in an office, and for a company to hire you, you'll likely need a relevant degree.” “A bachelor's degree in finance, accounting, economics, business, or mathematics could be a good first step to a financial career. Those looking to become a financial advisor in college would also be wise to look into related courses that could help them with advising and finding work in the fields that employ them. A couple of classes about investing and financial planning could go a long way to not just expanding your knowledge, but diversifying your career options.” “Some advisors want to be able to help their clients by buying and trading stocks, and they'll need certain licenses. Even just giving advice pertaining to investments requires a license. Financial advisors at insurance companies will also need licenses to sell and advise on insurance.” All the best to you. I hope I could answer your question properly. Thank you, Dominick Dibona

In Singapore, it is relatively easy to become a financial advisor. There is a high turnover in the industry, whether banks or insurers, whether tied agencies or independent agencies. Becoming a financial advisor is not the difficult part. Staying one for years, and developing credibility in the industry is. You may choose to contact any bank or insurer, especially when they are recruiting, which can be at career fairs, roadshows, or even ask your financial advisor friends. You will be sent for an interview process. There will be a CRO check to make sure that you have never been charged in court with property crimes such as fraud or theft. If you ever have, then you will not be accepted. The ethics requirements are strict. Secondly, the prospective hiring agency will arrange for you to take the requisite papers with the Singapore College of Insurance or equivalent. These papers, M5, M8, M8A, M9, M9A and HI. Generally, the minimum passing grade is to get at least 75% of questions correct. Alternative, you may choose to do so for yourself. You may book online at the SCI web site. There are also classes and textbooks should you require. Some people require multiple attempts to pass these examinations. Once you have passed, the results will be passed on to MAS, and they will review before issuing you an RNF code, which is your license number, as a financial advisor, or representative of a financial institution. And that is it.
